articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Ugandan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Ugandan President
Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Feb. 23 sent a congratulatory message to Yoweri Kaguta Museveni upon his reelection as President of Uganda.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields and wished him success in his work to consolidate the peace of the country and the national unity and achieve economic development.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Malaysian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Malaysian Ambassador 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, had a talk with outgoing Malaysian Ambassador to the DPRK Rahimi Bin Harun at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Paektusan Prize Sports Contest Closes
articles.content:
Paektusan Prize Sports Contest Closes
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Prize Sports Contest was closed with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street on Monday. It was opened on Feb. 8 on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Competed there were 10 events including volleyball, basketball and handball.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kang Nung Su, officials concerned and sportspersons.
					
					 Prizes were awarded to the organizations and players which proved successful at the contest.
					
					 Minister of Physical Culture and Sports Pak Myong Chol made a closing address.

articles.title: First Crop Likely to Be Adversely Affected by Snow
articles.content:
First Crop Likely to Be Adversely Affected by Snow
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- It snowed after raining in most areas of the DPRK Sunday. According to data available, Kosong County had 50 mm rainfall, Jangphung County 41 mm and Kosan County 39 mm from 00:00 am Sunday to 9:00 am Monday. 
					 The rain was followed by heavy snowfalls in different parts of the country, including Kangwon and South Hamgyong provinces.
					
					 The snow lies 38 cm deep in Kosong County, 32 cm in Thongchon County, 27 cm in Wonsan City, 25 cm in Sepho County and 23 cm in Hamhung City.
					
					 Agricultural experts are of the view that the snow will adversely affect first crop sowing.

articles.title: Comedies Enjoy Popularity in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Comedies Enjoy Popularity in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Comedians of the Mansudae Art Troupe and the State Theatrical Troupe have performed at the Yun I Sang Concert Hall in Pyongyang, enjoying a great popularity.
					 The programme includes gags, witty talks and comedies.
					
					 The gag "Sunday" performed by Ri Sun Hong (53), a merited artist of the Mansudae Art Troupe, gives a humorous story that one should spend red-letter days in a diversified and cheerful way to enjoy a cultured life and a good health.
					
					 He gets encores for his nimble two or three-person acting.
					
					 The witty talk "Noodle, Korean Nation's Dish" is based on deep care shown by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for developing Pyongyang cold noodle.
					
					 The witty talk "Switch" calls for economizing electricity.
					
					 Among the pieces are other witty talks "Names of Daughter and Son" and "Love and Respect".
					
					 The performance gives the audience a better understanding of the advantages of the socialist system.

articles.title: Portable pH Measuring Device Developed
articles.content:
Portable pH Measuring Device Developed
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Academy of Sciences has developed a portable pH (potential of hydrogen) measuring device.
					 The light and small device is high in accuracy and low in production cost.
					
					The semiconductor device is safer in usage and faster in measurement than the glass electrode one. It can be applicable to measuring things with radical change in pH, temperature and current.
					
					 It takes only a few seconds for the device to measure the pH value.
					
					 The device is also available for water and soil examination.

articles.title: Traditional Sports Encouraged
articles.content:
Traditional Sports Encouraged
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Traditional sports with a long history are gaining popularity among people of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Among them are ssirum (Korean wrestling), swinging, seesawing, archery, tug of war, shuttlecock game, top spinning and kite-flying.
					
					 Easy to play in any time and in any place, they are congenial to the Korean people's physical constitution and emotion.
					
					 Taekwon-Do reflecting the nation's spirit is popular at home and abroad, with local and international tournaments held frequently.
					
					 The National Ssirum Tournament for Grand Bull Prize has been held in Pyongyang as an annual event.
					
					Traditional sports games take place in parks, pleasure grounds, industrial establishments, farms and schools throughout the country on the folk holidays.
					
					 Men and women enjoy tug of war, Janggi (Korean chess), yut-game, swinging and seesawing, while children like to play kite-flying, top spinning, shuttlecock and rope-skipping.

articles.title: Korean Acrobatic Feat "Fliers"
articles.content:
Korean Acrobatic Feat "Fliers"
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Korean Acrobatic feat "Fliers" won the top prize at the 19th Massy International Circus Festival held in France some time ago.
					 The three-dimensional feat begins with a girl flying 11 meters diagonally from a swing.
					
					 It fascinates the audience with flying stunts like 20m flight and double and treble somersaults.

articles.title: Dish in Cooking Brazier
articles.content:
Dish in Cooking Brazier
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Korean Association of Cooks recently organized a national sinsollo (dish in cooking brazier) contest.
					 The contest drew 26 units from throughout the country.
					
					 The boiled dish is a mixture of prepared trepangs, lobsters, meat, vegetables, edible herbs and fruits.
					
					 It is considered one of the delicacies in the country.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il said sinsollo is one of Korea's typical dishes and called for improving its cookery.

articles.title: Celebrated Writer of Children's Poetry
articles.content:
Celebrated Writer of Children's Poetry
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Jong So Chon was a famous writer of Korea who composed more than 280 juvenile poems in his lifetime.
					 His most important works are collections of poems "Children of Korea", "Flower Letter" and "Our Beautiful Country".
					
					 The words of the song "Children's Union March" and the poem "Footstep" are still popular among children. 
					
					 "Children's Union March" written right after the liberation of the country from the Japanese colonial rule sings of the Korean children's oath to prepare themselves as sons and daughters of a new democratic Korea with their pride of being members of the Korean Children's Union.
					
					 "Footstep" represents the blissful life of the children through a vivid expression of their mind and emotion.
					
					 His works are of weighty significance in the history of juvenile literature.

articles.title: Jang Sung Op's Paintings
articles.content:
Jang Sung Op's Paintings 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Jang Sung Op (1843-1897) was a famous Korean painter representing the 19th century. 
					 After losing his parents in his childhood, he practiced the art of drawing, living a servant's life.
					
					 After years of painting, he invented a peculiar drawing style different from the existing one. It is characterized by a vivid depiction reflecting national characteristics.
					
					 Many of his works are animal, still life and flower pictures. 
					
					 "Reed and Crab", "Kingfisher by Pondside", "Hawk", "Wild Geese" and "Soldiers and Horses" are typical of his realistic works.
					
					 The works show his excellent single stroke technique and tour de force.

articles.title: Singijongi, Multi-launch Weapon
articles.content:
Singijongi, Multi-launch Weapon
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Among the Korean nation's heritages is a weapon called Singijongi which is considered to be the origin of multi-launch rocket system.
					 It, made in the early 15th century, is a weapon launching 100 arrows with fire wicks in a successive or simultaneous way.
					
					 The weapon installed on a cart consists of seven-layer main body, the lowest layer with 10 holes and others with 15 holes, and a foundation.
					
					 Each hole has a wooden launching tube. Iron plate covers the tube's inside to keep the tube from being aflame when arrows are launched.
					
					 A low stake is fixed vertically to the foundation so that the weapon can easily change its firing direction.
					
					 Firing angle is adjusted in a way of lifting up and down the cart.
					
					 Swords and spears are attached to the cart to prevent enemy's access to it.
					
					 The weapon displayed its might in battles against Japanese aggressors during the Imjin Patriot War (1592-1598).

articles.title: Jonggwang Temple Renowned for Excellent Architecture
articles.content:
Jonggwang Temple Renowned for Excellent Architecture
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- There is the Jonggwang Temple, built in the mid-7th century, in Riwon County, South Hamgyong Province. 
					 It was rebuilt in 1814, a year of the Ri Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					 More than ten buildings existed in the temple during the Ri Dynasty. But several of them were ravaged by the Japanese imperialists during their colonial rule over Korea.
					
					 Pillars of its main building are thick, with their middle parts somewhat wider than other parts. Among them the four-corner pillars are thicker and higher, elevating the graceful features of the building.
					
					 The main building is decorated with various sculptures and golden painting representing the country's developed architecture at that time.
					
					 Buddhist pictures are seen on inner walls of another remaining building.
					
					 Standing in the temple is a three-storied, three-meter-high stone pagoda. 
					
					 The temple is well preserved as one of the country's cultural assets.

articles.title: US, S. Korea Condemned for Joint Military Maneuvers
articles.content:
US, S. Korea Condemned for Joint Military Maneuvers
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- If the U.S. and south Korean authorities unleash a war against the DPRK, they will see how strong the country's self-defensive war deterrent is, said a student of Kim Chaek University of Technology after the Panmunjom mission of the Korean People's Army issued a statement on Feb. 27.
					 Chu Kuk Chol, 29, told KCNA that the DPRK-targeted Key Resolve and Foal Eagle military maneuvers of the U.S. and south Korea are aimed to wreck the peace and stability of the Korean peninsula and aggravate the situation.
					
					 Kim Ju Yon, 26, a section chief of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, in an interview with KCNA said the U.S. and the south Korean authorities are not interested in improvement of relations with the DPRK, as evidenced by the joint maneuvers.
					
					 They, increasing the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula, are disturbers of peace and stability, she said.
					
					 "I fully support the Panmunjom mission's statement that our army and people will counter the nuclear blackmail by the aggressors with our own nuclear deterrent and their missile threat with our own missile striking method," she added.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on US-S. Korean Psywar and Military Maneuvers
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on US-S. Korean Psywar and Military Maneuvers
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Korean People's Army Sunday issued the following stern warning as regards the psychological warfare and military maneuvers against the DPRK on the part of the U.S. and the south Korean group of traitors:
					 Our army will stage a direct fire at the Rimjin Pavilion and other sources of the anti-DPRK psychological warfare, if this warfare by the south Korean puppet military persists in the frontline area.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will go into an all-out offensive to put an end to the U.S. imperialists' military occupation of south Korea and the anti-popular ruling system of the group of traitors. 
					
					 If the aggressors launch provocation for a "local war", the world will witness unprecedented all-out counteraction on the part of the army and people of the DPRK. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will counter the nuclear blackmail by the aggressors with its own nuclear deterrent and their missile threat with its own missile striking method.
					
					 This is the legitimate countermeasures to defend the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK from the U.S. and the south Korean group of traitors' reckless anti-DPRK attempt.
					
					 The gravity of their psywar and war maneuvers lies in that they are all aimed to "bring down" the DPRK.
					
					 In the past the south Korean group of traitors used to assert that the authorities had nothing to do with scattering anti-DPRK leaflets. But, it is now openly coming out for the psywar to disorganize the DPRK. The group let not only the military and anti-DPRK conservative organizations but also lawmakers from the "Grand National Party" scatter hundreds of thousands of leaflets, corrupt animation files, foul pamphlets and dirty goods in direction of the north side's area, extremely escalating the confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					The U.S. is behind such smear campaign. Its administration allotted, through democracy foundation affiliated to it, 450,000 dollars for south Korea's psychological warfare against the DPRK in January.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces did not hesitate to announce that the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises include a special operation to remove the DPRK's nuclear deterrent and they are aimed to "destroy" its system.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that they leave no stone unturned to stifle the DPRK and such actions are reaching a very dangerous stage.
					
					 The socialist fortress of the DPRK remains impregnable despite any psywar and military blackmail by the U.S. and south Korea.
					
					 It is a daydream of a fool to hope for "contingency" and "collapse" of the socialist system in the DPRK chosen and built by its people themselves.
					
					 The aggressors who dare challenge the socialist system of the DPRK will face the inexhaustible might of its army and people built up under the Songun policy.

articles.title: KCNA Denounces US-S. Korea Joint Exercises
articles.content:
KCNA Denounces US-S. Korea Joint Exercises 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet warmongers Monday started joint military exercises for aggression Key Resolve and Foal Eagle across south Korea. 
					 Huge armed troops of the U.S. forces and south Korean puppet army are combat-ready and groups for naval operations including a nuclear-powered aircraft carrier are deployed in the waters off south Korea. Strike flying corps including strategic bombers are ready to go into action. 
					
					 This is another grave move taken by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK and ignite a war, opposed to the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 Herein lies a true aim sought by the group of traitors in south Korea in deliberately torpedoing the preliminary talks for opening the north-south high-level military talks arranged with much effort to defuse the military tension on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 As already known, south Korea has consistently responded with ceaseless frantic war exercises targeted against the DPRK to the proposal for opening wide-ranging dialogue between the north and the south made in the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK. 
					
					 The day following the publication of the statement the Air Operation Command of the south Korean puppet army let gun-ships fly in the sky above Yangphyong area of Kyonggi Province and fire machine guns and missiles, kicking up a war atmosphere. The 5th Infantry Division of the army, a brigade for special warfare of the navy, the 103rd fighter squadron under the 8th combat flying corps of the air force, etc. of south Korea staged field tactical drills, exercises for naval infiltration, dropping bombs and strafing with offensive war equipment involved. 
					
					 Whenever the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises were staged  around the Korean Peninsula, the U.S. blustered that the nuclear-powered carrier George Washington would be dispatched there and it was necessary to cope with somebody's "local war." 
					
					 This is a blatant challenge and perfidy to the DPRK which has made ceaseless efforts and showed magnanimity to ensure dialogue and peaceful environment on the peninsula. 
					
					 Key Resolve and Foal Eagle are bound to drive the north-south relations to more serious catastrophe and increase the danger of war on the peninsula. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will counter with their own-style strike method against those who dare challenge its dignified socialist system through their adventurous joint saber-rattling.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Escalating Military Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Escalating Military Confrontation 
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- In order to defuse confrontation and tension prevailing on the Korean Peninsula it is necessary to halt all provocative acts of increasing the military threat against the other side and heightening the danger of war. Defusing the confrontation is a precondition for improving the inter-Korean relations. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes this in a by-lined article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are stoking war fever and escalating the tension to an extreme pitch, while giving lip service to "dialogue".
					
					 The efforts of one party alone are not enough to make dialogue successful. The south Korean authorities are staging the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers for a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK in league with the United States. These are deliberate moves to bring dialogue to rupture. 
					
					 It is essential for warming up the inter-Korean relations to stop the war exercises.  Saber-rattling is bound to aggravate distrust and confrontation and makes it impossible to mend the north-south relations, in the final analysis. 
					
					 The moves stepped up by the south Korean authorities to escalate confrontation and ignite a war are acts of treachery as they are to faithfully serve the purpose of foreign forces' policy for aggression of the DPRK.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations will never improve if the south Korean authorities persistently regard foreign forces as more important than compatriots and cooperate with those forces, indifferent to the destiny of the nation. 
					
					 They kicked off Key Resolve and Foal Eagle throughout south Korea together with U.S. forces despite the hands of good will extended to them. This is their undisguised cooperation with foreign forces in their moves for a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are increasing the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula, regarding the collusion with foreign forces as more important than the destiny of the nation and placing the interests of foreign forces above those of the nation. These despicable sycophancy and treachery are unpardonable.

articles.title: Young Koreans Should Take Lead in Opening Gate to Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Young Koreans Should Take Lead in Opening Gate to Thriving Nation
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The young people should take the lead in the drive to open the gate to a thriving nation, dashing ahead toward the future to the tune of the song "Korean Youth March" as they pledged at the Songun Meeting of Youth for General Mobilization.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in an editorial.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The meeting was held as the first event this year. It revealed the idea of the Workers' Party of Korea of attaching importance to the youth. It also offered an important occasion for boosting the dignity and honor of the Songun young vanguard and encouraging them to their best to open the gate to a thriving nation.
					
					 It is the glorious tradition of the Korean youth movement that it recorded the immortal feats in the annals of the revolution under the leadership of the party and the leader.
					
					 The great victory and remarkable successes of Songun Korea and edifices going by the name youth are associated with the precious blood and sweat shed by them dedicating their life to the party and the leader, the country and the people, singing the song "Korean Youth March".
					
					 The shining history of the Korean youth movement and the present reality prove the iron truth that no difficulties are insurmountable for the young people and victory and glory are always in store for them as they are led by the great leader and the great party. 
					
					 A new era of the Juche revolution is being ushered in and the high-pitched drive for opening the gate to a thriving nation is now underway. This is high time that the five million young people exalted their honor as the descendants of President Kim Il Sung, glorified the dignity of Songun Korea and gave the fullest play to the mental power hardened in the tempests of the revolution.
					
					 The youth should successfully play the role of a shock brigade in the general offensive for building a thriving socialist nation. They should also clearly show the praiseworthy appearance of the Korean young people who are brilliantly translating the behests and the ideal of the leader into reality, fluttering the flag of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.

articles.title: Workers in North and South of Korea Publish Peace Declaration
articles.content:
Workers in North and South of Korea Publish Peace Declaration
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea and the Federation of Trade Unions and the Confederation of Trade Unions of south Korea issued a peace declaration of the workers in the north and the south of Korea Monday.
					 The declaration expressed concern about the touch-and-go situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula. It urged the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to immediately halt the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises.
					
					 The north proposed wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations between the two sides. But the military authorities of south Korea kicked off the big maneuvers while calling for taking countermeasure against it, the declaration said. This is aimed to justify the military exercises, it added.
					
					 The exercises are a planned provocation to push the north-south relations to the brink of a war and they also reveal an intention to maintain the confrontation policy, the declaration said, adding:
					
					 All the Koreans are calling for negotiated settlement to all the issues amid the mounting danger of a war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should promptly come out for dialogue and negotiations with the north, though belatedly, from a sincere stand for peace and stability of the peninsula.
					
					 Calling for active solidarity and exchanges between the workers in the north and the south, the declaration denounced the south Korean authorities for having repeatedly disallowed contacts and visits between NGOs and people of various strata and inflicted legal punishment on them.
					
					 The declaration stated that the organizations would hold colorful events including a meeting of workers in the north and the south for reunification and promote solidarity and cooperation between them.
					
					 We will wage unflinching actions against those forces standing in the way of contacts, dialogue and cooperation between the workers from the north and the south, it declared.

articles.title: Dynamic Movement for Korea's Reunification Urged
articles.content:
Dynamic Movement for Korea's Reunification Urged
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) issued a statement on Feb. 25 on the occasion of the 16th anniversary of its formation.
					 The South Headquarters of Pomminryon has vigorously advanced along the road of national independence and great unity since its formation, the statement said.
					
					 The south-north relations have favorably developed since the publication of the June 15 joint declaration. But they were driven to a catastrophe owing to the moves of the U.S. and sycophantic treacherous forces against reunification, bringing dark clouds of a war to hang heavily over the Korean Peninsula, it deplored.
					
					 The history and the reality clearly show that the unity and reunification are the ways for the Koreans to exist and prosper, it said. It called upon all the Koreans to give further momentum to the solidarity movement among the people in the south and the north and overseas.
					
					 It emphasized that the South Headquarters of Pomminryon would stage more dynamic movement for national reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Political Party Calls for Judging Present Regime
articles.content:
S. Korean Political Party Calls for Judging Present Regime 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the south Korean Democratic Labor Party urged to judge the present south Korean authorities in a commentary released on Feb. 25.
					 The commentary termed the 3-year rule of the authorities a dark period ridden by inefficiency, corruption and dictatorship.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The successes made in the drive for democracy are brought to naught and the tyrannical rule, the terror policy in the days of the military dictatorship has revived with economy declining in south Korea.
					
					 The worst crimes committed by the present regime are that they broke down the south-north relations. This brought the south Korean citizens only fear of a war.
					
					 In a word, south Korea is on the verge of a collapse, it said, expressing their will to judge the present "government" without fail by the concerted efforts of the people.

articles.title: Repression of Reunification Champion Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repression of Reunification Champion Flailed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Youth and student organizations in south Korea on Feb. 24 criticized the puppet prosecution for its scheme to remand Yun Ki Jin, ex-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance of Youth and Students for Korea's Reunification.
					 The prosecution authorities requested an arrest warrant for Yun on the charge of violation of the "National Security Law", finding fault with an article written by him in jail.
					
					 Slashing at this behavior, the Youth Solidarity in a statement said: Yun had to serve his term of imprisonment for the mere reason that he worked hard for the country's independent and peaceful reunification and social democracy. Not content with this, the prosecution again requested the warrant of arrest for Yun who is to be set free at the expiration of his term. It is a very deplorable deed.
					
					 The statement demanded that the "government" abrogate the NSL, an evil law against human rights, as early as possible and set free all of those detained on unreasonable charges.
					
					 The Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in a commentary branded the said behavior as an unprecedented repression.
					
					 The youth and students will surely call the prosecution authorities to task for such inhumane deed, said the commentary.

articles.title: Crimes of "Government" Exposed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Crimes of "Government" Exposed in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Organizations of south Korea on Feb. 23 published a white paper titled "Egotism and dogmatism, three years of degradation" disclosing the crimes committed by the south Korean puppet authorities in three years of office.
					 They are the Professors' Union, the Council of Professors for Democracy and the Council of Scientific Organizations.
					
					 The organizations called a news conference in Seoul that day as regard the publication of the paper.
					
					 Speakers at the conference said that the last three years after the emergence of the present "government" were consistent with arrogance and arbitrariness and thus the society was doomed to crisis and democracy was nominal.
					
					 From the very day of its birth, the "government" has insisted on the policy of confrontation while rejecting the south-north dialogue and, after all, dark clouds of war are hanging over this land, they charged.
					
					 What the south Korean people should do is to put the wheels of history in correct direction, they said, adding that reappearance of such "government" should be checked.

articles.title: Anti-regime Struggle Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-regime Struggle Launched in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The progressive political party and civic and social bodies held a rally judging the tyranny of the puppet authorities of south Korea. It was held in the plaza outside the Seoul municipal office on Feb. 25.
					 They included the Democratic Labor Party, the Solidarity for Social Progress and the Citizen's Solidarity for Democracy Society.
					
					 After the present authorities came to power, the south Koreans' employment became instable as the days go by and the common people found it harder and harder to make both ends meet, they said. The economic crisis is threatening the people like a time bomb, they deplored.
					
					 The tension between the south and the north of Korea run high as the authorities have only pressed for the policy for confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north to push the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the extremes, they said.
					
					 The people's mindset has gone beyond the tolerance limit, they said. They will never remain a passive on-looker to the prevailing situation caused by the tyranny of the "government" and the "Grand National Party", they added.
					
					 They appealed to all the progressive forces to get united to oust the present unpopular dictatorial regime and strive hard to build a new society.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Moves to Grab Chongryon Facilities Denounced
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Moves to Grab Chongryon Facilities Denounced
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries have gone to the extremes in their moves to grab the facilities of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 On Feb. 18 the Tokyo District Court made a decision approving the application of the resolution and collection corporation for the provisional seizure of land and buildings of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon.
					
					 The court judged over 62. 7 billion yen out of the total bond which the resolution and collection corporation bought from the former Tokyo Credit Association of the Korean Bank in June 2007 as a loan and ruled that Chongryon should reimburse the total amount. 
					
					 According to this, the resolution and collection corporation seized the Chongryon buildings provisionally on Feb. 21.
					
					 These moves are aimed to do harm to Chongryon, the legitimate overseas compatriots' organization of the DPRK.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Observe Kim Jong Il's Birthday
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Observe Kim Jong Il's Birthday
Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries gave special write-ups to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 China's newspaper Heilongjiang Daily on Feb. 16 carried articles titled "Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, leading fruit producer", "Kaeson Youth Park presenting world of ecstatic dream", etc. with a photo of Kim Jong Il receiving the Chinese minister of Public Security.
					
					 Also edited in the paper were pictures of the Korean people leading worthwhile working life and spending pleasant time of rest.
					
					 The Feb. 16th issue of the Kuwaiti newspaper Kuwait Times gave one whole page to articles titled "The Juche idea and economic development of the DPRK", "The underground resources, focus of the world", etc. with photos of Kim Jong Il waving back to the cheering crowd and providing field guidance to the Huichon Power Station under construction.
					
					 In an article entitled "The ideal of leader Kim Jong Il" the paper said: The international community is witnessing the reality that the building of a thriving nation, the wish of President Kim Il Sung and the ideal of Kim Jong Il, is being realized in the DPRK.
					
					 The Namibian paper New Era on Feb. 11 said in an article titled "The DPRK's mode of building a thriving nation seen through one slogan": The slogan "Look out over the world while keeping your feet firmly planted on your own land!" reflects the steadfast will of the Korean people to build a thriving nation their own way under the uplifted banner of the Juche idea. 
					
					 The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional and the Syrian paper Al Baath on Feb. 15 carried articles introducing the Korean people who are conducting a general offensive full of confidence in victory without the slightest wavering in the drive to build a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between Feb. 13 and 16 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They included a friendly meeting, photo exhibition and a film show in Myanmar and a meeting, photo exhibition and a film show in India.
					
					 Displayed in their venues were books and photos on the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Films shown included "The Tower of the Juche Idea", "The Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu" and "Arms of Korea".
					
					 The director of the International Department of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar said in a friendly meeting that the Korean people and other world progressives were recalling with deep emotion the undying feats of Kim Jong Il for prosperity and development of the country and freedom and happiness of the people and global independence.
					
					 New miracles have been wrought in different fields of the DPRK's national economy thanks to his unbreakable faith and tireless and distinguished Songun leadership, he added.
					
					 Balzor Singh Chauhan, chairman of the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung, said at a meeting that Kim Jong Il achieved a harmonious whole of the leader and the people and that socialist Korea stood unshaken despite any political adversity thanks to this single-minded unity.
					
					 Kim Jong Il has shown the road ahead of the world people desirous of independence by developing in depth the Juche idea, he stressed.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting held by the Indian Intellectuals' Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised in Peru
						
Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Cultural Center in Peru issued a bulletin to mark the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The bulletin carried an article with his photos.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was born in the secret camp on Mt. Paektu on February 16, 1942.
					
					 Born of a patriotic and revolutionary family, he grew up to be the successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 He, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, continues to provide field guidance to different sectors of the national economy.
					
					 The Korean people are advancing toward a higher goal.
					
					 This year the DPRK set it as a major task to bring about a decisive turn in improving the people's standard of living and building a thriving nation by accelerating the light industry once again.
					
					 Elaborating on the great successes made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation, the bulletin said that all the achievements are attributable to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: US Radio on Increased Operation Rate of Farm Machines in DPRK
articles.content:
US Radio on Increased Operation Rate of Farm Machines in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- VOA, a radio of the United States, reported that the operating rate of tractors, threshers and other farm machines is increasing in the DPRK to exert a good effect on its agricultural production.
					 It quoted a report released by the Rural Economy Institute of south Korea to make this report.

articles.title: VOA Reports Statement of NDC Inspection Group of DPRK
articles.content:
VOA Reports Statement of NDC Inspection Group of DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- VOA broadcast in detail the second installment of the statement issued by the inspection group of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK on Feb. 23.
					 Conveying the statement it said that the army of north Korea, prompted by its desire to avert a military clash in the sensitive waters and preserve peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, sent a telephone message to the south Korean military at 8:00 on Nov. 23, but artillery pieces on Yonphyong Island fired shells into the territorial waters of north Korea in the end.

articles.title: Obama on High Unemployment Rate
articles.content:
Obama on High Unemployment Rate
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Unemployment is still way too high all across the country, U.S. President Barack Obama said on Thursday.
					 The stubbornly high unemployment is the biggest challenge facing the nation currently, he said while meeting with members of the newly- established President's Council on Jobs and Competitiveness.

articles.title: Russian Presidential Envoy on Development of Kurils
articles.content:
Russian Presidential Envoy on Development of Kurils
 Moscow, February 26 (KCNA) -- The presidential envoy to the Far East Region of Russia referred to a plan for developing the Kurils at a press conference on Feb. 21. 
					 Russia will earmark a lot of funds for the development of the Kurils out of the federal and regional budgets and, at the same time, invite foreign investors, he said.
					
					 He said that Russia proposed Japan a joint development of the Kurils and took a series of prudent measures, but the latter had never responded to them. 
					
					 If companies or investors of Japan don't move, people of China, Singapore and other countries will come there, he added.
					
					 The Kurils are the territory where Russia exercises its sovereignty and it will develop the region, he stressed.

articles.title: Australia's Alliance with US No Longer Guarantees Success
articles.content:
Australia's Alliance with US No Longer Guarantees Success
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Australia's distrust in the alliance with the United States is deepening. 
					 According to Australian Strategic Policy Institute (ASPI), the U.S. influence in the Asian region declines. 
					
					 A think tank on Thursday said Australia's strategic environment is becoming more complex and its alliance with the United States is no longer the guarantee of success it once was.

articles.title: Cuba to Punish US Spy
articles.content:
Cuba to Punish US Spy
 Havana February 26 (KCNA) -- Cuba will try U.S. spy Alan Gross in March.
					 On Feb. 24, the Cuban government filed against Gross a preliminary charge of infringement upon the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Cuba. He was accused of spying and supporting counter-revolutionary forces in Cuba, it held.
					
					 U.S. citizen Gross was arrested in December, 2009 at the Havana airport on charges of providing Internet satellite communications equipment to counter-revolutionary forces based on the island.

articles.title: Japan Has No Future without Reparation
articles.content:
Japan Has No Future without Reparation
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Some countries have sincerely apologized to the international community for their crimes and compensated to their victims after the Second World War.
					 But Japan has failed for more than half a century to compensate to the Korean and other Asian people for their heinous crimes, inviting strong criticism in the UN and other international conferences.
					
					 Even U.S. Congress adopted a resolution denouncing Japan's war crimes and urging it to make an apology and reparation.
					
					 Prescription is not available for Japan's brutal crimes so that it should be forced to pay for them.
					
					 If Japan truly wants to win trust from the international community, it should promptly redress its past wrongdoings. 
					
					 It is impossible for Japan to think about its future without reparation.

articles.title: False Marriage Sparks Public Criticism in Japan
articles.content:
False Marriage Sparks Public Criticism in Japan
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- False marriage is rampant in Japan, touching off strong public criticism.
					 The police authorities of Japan announced on Feb. 24 that the number of forged marriages with foreigners, exposed across the country last year, reached to 153 cases, an increase of 14.2 percent over the previous year.

articles.title: International Efforts for Solving Food Shortage
articles.content:
International Efforts for Solving Food Shortage
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Many countries are experiencing a food shortage caused by a grain output decrease due to abnormal climatic conditions such as drought, flood, biting cold and avalanche, as well as foodstuff price hike.
					 The World Economic Forum held in Switzerland in January mainly discussed overcoming the food crisis. Food experts warned that the food shock would be a more serious economic problem than the oil shock.
					
					 The international community has made efforts for solving the food problem.
					
					 Some time ago, the vice president of Burundi said at an agricultural meeting that the government has launched on a new plan for increasing the agricultural production. Saying that the country has potentialities enough to raise the agricultural production, he underscored the need to improve the farming methods to produce more grains.
					
					 Venezuela has set it as one of the government's main tasks to ensure food security. The government plans to establish a regular food supply system and boost the agricultural production this year by increasing state assistance.
					
					 From the beginning of the year, China has directed much effort to developing agriculture. The country issued an urgent notice for ensuring a stable agricultural output and adopted a decision for reconditioning electric power networks in the countryside.
					
					 Other countries have also taken measures for solving the food problem with increased agricultural production.
					
					 Discussions and measures concerning the food crisis have been made worldwide.
					
					 Bilateral and multilateral cooperation and exchange have also been brisk in the fields of agricultural production, science and technology.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con embajador de Malasia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con embajador de Malasia
Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 28 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el embajador malasio en Corea, Rahimi Bin Harun, quien le hizo una visita de despedida.

articles.title: Premier coreano visita campo de construccion de central de Huichon
articles.content:
Premier coreano visita campo de construccion de central de Huichon
						
Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ATCC) -- Los dias 23 y 24, el premier coreano del Consejo de Ministros, Choe Yong Rim, averiguo en el terreno como marcha la obra de la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon.
					Recorriendo varios lugares incluyendo el dique de Ryongrim, las galerias y el lugar de construccion de las salas de generadores de las centrales no.1 y no.2, escucho explicaciones detalladas del cumplimiento de las instrucciones dadas en el terreno por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y de los problemas surgidos en la obra.
					
					Convoco la reunion de los funcionarios de las ramas relacionadas.
					
					En la ocasion hubo debates sobre los problemas para terminar con adelanto la obra y se exigio a todos los funcionarios y constructores asegurar en el maximo nivel la calidad de construcciones respetando la norma.
					
					Ademas, fueron tomadas las medidas concretas para que el Consejo de Ministros, los comites, los ministerios, los organos centrales y otras entidades relacionadas suministren a tiempo los equipos y materiales encargados.

articles.title: Se ofrece en Pyongyang la funcion de humoristas
articles.content:
Se ofrece en Pyongyang la funcion de humoristas
Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ATCC) -- Ahora en la capitalina Casa de Musica Yun I Sang se ofrece la funcion de los humoristas del Conjunto Artistico Mansudae y el Conjunto Dramatico Nacional.
					"El domingo", pieza interpretada por el actor benemerito del Conjunto Artistico Mansudae, Ri Sun Hong (de 53 anos de edad), ensena entre risas la moraleja de que se debe organizar bien el descanso en cada domingo y otros dias feriados para ser hombres mas cultos y fuertes.
					
					Durante su actuacion, el cambia su voz imitando las de mujer, nino y anciano.
					
					La charla comica "Fideo-plato nacional" demuestra de modo impresionante el calido amor por el pueblo del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente          Kim Jong Il reflejado en el fideo en caldo frio Pyongyang.
					
					La otra "El interruptor" ensena de modo comico que en esta cosa pequena estan las posibilidades de ahorrar mucha electricidad.
					
					La funcion hace sentir a los espectadores la superioridad del sistema socialista.

articles.title: ATCC comenta ejercicios militares conjuntos EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ATCC comenta ejercicios militares conjuntos EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ATCC) -- Estados Unidos y los titeres surcoreanos comenzaron desde hoy los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho" en toda la extension surcoreana.
					  Las enormes fuerzas armadas de EE.UU. y el ejercito titere surcoreano entraron en la disposicion de combate contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y se desplegaron en las zonas maritimas cercanas al Sur de Corea los colectivos de operacion naval como portaaviones de propulsion nuclear.
					
					  Estan listas para el despegue tambien las aviaciones de ataque como bombarderos estrategicos.
					
					  Esto resulta otro paso de enfrentamiento anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos que no desean la paz ni la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana. He aqui la verdadera intencion con que la banda de traidores surcoreanos frustro el dialogo previo para las conversaciones militares de alto nivel Norte-Sur de Corea, abierto dificilmente para el alivio de tension militar de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  Como ya conocido, desde que fue publicada la declaracion conjunta del gobierno, los partidos politicos y las entidades de la RPDC de sostener el dialogo amplio entre el Norte y el Sur, los titeres surcoreanos libran freneticamente los ejercicios de guerra anti-RPDC.
					
					  Al dia siguiente de publicacion de esa nota, la comandancia de operacion aerea de las fuerzas terrestres surcoreanas mando los helicopteros de ataque a la zona de Yangphyong de la provincia de Kyonggi para que realizaran el tiro con ametralladoras y misiles.
					
					  La division de infanteria no. 5, la brigada especial de las fuerzas navales, el batallon 103 de la aviacion no. 8 realizaron el ejercito tactico al aire libre, el de penetracion en el mar, el bombardeo y el disparo de ametralladora.
					
					  Cada vez que se libraban los ejercicios militares conjuntos, EE.UU. amenazo con enviar el portaaviones nucleares "George Washington" y llamo a prepararse para la supuesta "batalla local".
					
					  Tal proceder significa desafio y traicion a la RPDC que se esfuerza constante y magnanimamente por preparar el clima de dialogo y paz en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho" llevaran inevitablemente a la fase mas desastrosa las relaciones N-S y causaran el resultado de agravar el peligro de guerra en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  A esos ejercicios aventureros desafiantes al muy digno sistema socialista de la RPDC, el ejercito y el pueblo de esta responderan con el ataque a su estilo.

articles.title: ATCC comenta la ambicion irrisoria de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ATCC comenta la ambicion irrisoria de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ATCC) -- Frente a la campana psicologica contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el entrenamiento de guerra de Estados Unidos y los titeres surcoreanos, el Ejercito Popular de Corea les advirtio el dia 27 como lo siguiente:
					Avisamos oficialmente que si prosiguen tales actos de la capa militar surcoreana en las areas del frente, se abrira el fuego a punteria directa contra los focos de campana psicologica anti-RPDC, incluso el pabellon Rimjin.
					
					Nuestro ejercito y pueblo entraran en la ofensiva general para acabar con la ocupacion militar del Sur de Corea por parte de los imperialistas norteamericanos y derrumbar el sistema de dominacion antinacional de la banda de los traidores surcoreanos. Y responderan con la justa guerra total nunca vista por el mundo a la "batalla local" que desaten aquellos. 
					
					Nuestro ejercito y pueblo responderan a los chantajes nucleares de los agresores con el disuasivo nuclear a nuestro estilo, y a la amenaza de misiles con nuestro ataque de misiles a nuestra manera.
					
					Estas declaraciones constituyen la justa contramedida de la RPDC para defender su dignidad y la soberania desde las irrealizables ambiciones de EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos para atropellarla.
					
					La campana psicologica y el ejercicio militar persiguen la meta comun de derrumbar a la RPDC.
					
					La banda de traidores surcoreanos hablaba antes que el lanzamiento de volantes de contenido anti-RPDC por parte de las entidades conservadoras no tiene que ver con las autoridades.
					
					Pero, ahora moviliza a la capa militar, las entidades conservadoras anti-RPDC y hasta a los "parlamentarios" del "Gran Partido Nacional" en mandar al territorio de la RPDC cientos de miles de volantes, multimedias, folletos y otras porquerias. 
					
					Detras de tal complot, esta Estados Unidos.
					
					En enero, la administracion norteamericana desembolso por conducto del Fondo Democratico, adscrito a si misma, 450 mil US$ para esa campana psicologica anti-RPDC.
					
					Para colmo, EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos no ocultan que "Key Resolve" y "Aguilucho" comprenden una operacion especial para eliminar el disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC y "derrumbar" luego el regimen de la misma.
					
					La realidad demuestra que ellos no reparan en medios ni en metodos para aplastar a la RPDC.
					
					La RPDC, fortaleza del socialismo, se mantiene inexpugnable aunque ellos perpetran la guerra psicologica o ejercen el chantaje militar.
					
					Esperar el "estado emergente" y el "derrumbe" en el regimen socialista, optado y construido por el pueblo coreano, no pasa de ser una ilusion vana.
					
					Los agresores, que se atrevieron a desafiar al digno regimen socialista de la RPDC, probaran las inagotables fuerzas del ejercito y el pueblo de ella forjadas en virtud del Songun.

articles.title: Clausurada competencia deportiva por la Copa Paektusan
articles.content:
Clausurada competencia deportiva por la Copa Paektusan
Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ATCC) -- Quedo clausurada el dia 28 en el Centro de Baloncesto del Reparto Chongchun la Competencia Deportiva por la Copa Paektusan, inaugurada el dia 8, con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					En el presente torneo se efectuaron los partidos de 10 disciplinas, entre ellas, voleibol, baloncesto y balonmano.
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Kang Nung Su y otros funcionarios junto con los deportistas y hubo la premiacion a los equipos deportivos y los jugadores que ganaron buenas notas.
					
					  El ministro de Deportes, Pak Myong Chol, pronuncio discurso de clausura.
